quote: "I love what I do, so I do it best".
name: OTMAN KHARBOUCH
description: I am a MERN Stack Developer with a passion for creating beautiful and functional web applications. I have experience in building full-stack applications using JavaScript, React, Node.js, and Express.js. I am always looking for new opportunities to learn and grow as a developer.
about-text: Otman Kharbouch, a versatile full-stack web developer, proficient in building robust web applications using both the MERN stack and the PHP Laravel & Vue.js stack. Passionate about embracing new technologies and continuously expanding my skillset, I am always eager to learn and grow. I am a team player with excellent communication skills and a strong work ethic. I am looking for new opportunities to work on exciting projects and collaborate with other developers.
education1-description1: YouCode is an inclusive school focused on individual-centered learning and teamwork. "You" represents the person, and "Code" stands for development. More info at <a href="https://youcode.ma" target="_blank" class="link-prm"   >Youcode.ma</a >
education2-description1: I completed online courses in web development, including FreeCodeCamp's Responsive Web Design and Codecademy's JavaScript and MongoDB, enhancing my skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MongoDB.
education-description: I completed my high school education with a scientific baccalaureate in physics and chemistry, which helped me develop my analytical and problem-solving skills.
p1-context: This project was completed in 1 month and served as the final assignment for YouCode's first year
p1-description: This solution allows users to easily book tables at cafes and restaurants directly from the menu, helping businesses efficiently manage reservations and optimize table occupancy.
p2-context: This project was built in 1 week by a team of 4 developers.
p2-description: Hint is a blog platform for Youcode students to share articles, discuss topics, and interact with each otherâ€”all through a user-friendly interface.
p3-context: This is a minimalistic game, made in 3 days as an introduction to NodeJS.
p3-description: Ixo-Multiplayer is an online game where two players compete on a 20x20 grid, aiming to align 5 'X' or 'O' symbols horizontally, vertically, or diagonally while blocking their opponent.
p4-context: This is part of a larger project developed for a delivery service called AlloMedia.
p4-description: A RESTful API built with Node.js and Express.js for user authentication and authorization, using JWT tokens to secure routes. It connects to a MongoDB database to securely store user data.
exp1-description: Cegedim is a global tech and services group specializing in healthcare,  data management, and CRM solutions for life sciences, insurers, and  healthcare professionals.
exp1-contributions:
- Maintained and enhanced an existing project during my internship at Cegedim.

- Improved overall security by identifying and resolving key vulnerabilities.

- Enhanced UI/UX for a more intuitive and user-friendly interface.

- Contributed to stability and performance optimizations through refactoring.

- Collaborated with the team to ensure secure and scalable code practices.
exp2-description: Moussasoft is a Moroccan IT company specializing in web and mobile development, digital solutions, and custom software tailored for businesses to enhance their digital presence and operational efficiency.
exp2-contributions:
- Contributed to website development by implementing requested changes and fixing bugs.

- Responsible for deploying tested and stable versions to production.

- Led a small development team, coordinating tasks and ensuring deadlines.

exp-note: I've also completed various freelance projects, which I prefer not to list due to client confidentiality and personal discretion.

education1-description:
YouCode is a transformative two-year web development program that blends front-end and back-end training with soft skills like teamwork and project management. Partnered with UM6P and inspired by the Simplon.co model, it adopts a project-based learning approach to tackle real-world challenges.
Supported by OCP and connected to the 1337 network, YouCode offers access to cutting-edge resources in a dynamic environment. Students graduate as confident, industry-ready professionals, equipped for future tech leadership.
education1-program-description: At YouCode, the curriculum is designed to provide a comprehensive foundation in both front-end and back-end web development, along with essential tools and methodologies for modern software development.
education1-list:
• Front-End Development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular, Vue.js, Next.js, React Native.
  • Back-End Development: PHP, Laravel, Nest.js, ExpressJs
  • Databases: MongoDB, MySQL, DynamoDB
  • Web Servers: Apache, Nginx.
  • Operating Systems and Scripting: Linux, Bash, CMD.
  • Project Management: Jira, Trello
  • Development Practices: Agile methodologies, version control (Git/GitHub)
education1-final: By engaging with this diverse stack, students graduate as versatile developers equipped to tackle real-world challenges and adapt to the ever-changing tech landscape.
education2-description:
Codecademy and FreeCodeCamp are leading platforms in the realm of e-learning, offering comprehensive courses in web development and programming. These platforms provide a flexible and accessible way to learn coding skills, catering to both beginners and advanced learners.
Codecademy offers interactive coding lessons in various programming languages, including JavaScript, Python, and HTML/CSS. Their hands-on approach ensures that learners can immediately apply what they learn through practical exercises and projects.
FreeCodeCamp is renowned for its extensive curriculum that covers front-end and back-end development. It emphasizes project-based learning, allowing students to build real-world applications and gain practical experience. The platform also offers certifications upon completion of its rigorous courses.
education2-learn: Learn more about Codecademy at Codecademy and FreeCodeCamp at FreeCodeCamp
education2-program-description: The curriculum for the Responsive Web Design course on FreeCodeCamp and the JavaScript course on Codecademy is designed to provide a solid foundation in web development and programming.
education2-list:
FreeCodeCamp - Responsive Web Design

  • Basic HTML and HTML5
  • Basic CSS
  • Applied Visual Design
  • Applied Accessibility
  • Responsive Web Design Principles
  • CSS Flexbox
  • CSS Grid
  • Responsive Web Design Projects

Codecademy - JavaScript

  • Introduction to JavaScript
  • JavaScript Syntax
  • Functions
  • Conditionals, Arrays, Loops, Iterators, Objects, Scope
  • Classes
  • Browser Compatibility and Transpilation
  • JavaScript Projects
education-final: By engaging with these comprehensive courses, students gain the skills needed to build responsive websites and develop proficiency in JavaScript programming.
